lectures.location: Notes in App and Recorded Lectures Online
lectures.notes: Access lecture notes in this app and recorded lectures on LMS (available anytime)

additionalInfo.title: Textbook
additionalInfo.content: There is no required textbook. Course notes and resources are provided in this app and on LMS.

additionalInfo.title: Required Software
additionalInfo.content: Python 3.10+ is required for lab exercises. We recommend Miniconda — a lightweight installer that includes Python, Jupyter Notebook, and the conda package manager. Download the version that matches your operating system and processor chip (e.g. Intel/AMD vs Apple Silicon on Mac). You can also access Python through UniApps or Google Colab.

additionalInfo.title: Lab Handbook
additionalInfo.content: The Lab Handbook contains important information about lab attendance, participation requirements, and assessment details.

additionalInfo.title: Calculator Policy
additionalInfo.content: Scientific calculators are permitted in the final exam. Graphing calculators and programmable calculators are NOT permitted.

additionalInfo.title: Exceptional Variation of Assessment (EVA)
additionalInfo.content: If you experience exceptional circumstances beyond your control that prevent you from performing to your ability, you can apply for EVA. This includes short-term health conditions, hardship, trauma, unavoidable commitments, and bereavement.
